title: Aen 1 19-22 - SS syllabus - History - Punic Wars

content.description:
Progeniemprogenies, -ei, f.: offspring sed enim Troiano a sanguine duci 
audierat; TyriasTyrius, -a, -um, adj.: Tyrian, of Tyre olim quae verteret arces; 
hinc populum late regem belloque superbum 
venturum excidioexcidium, -i, n.: destruction LibyaeLibya, -ae, f.: Libya (a country in north Africa).
content.question: The destruction (excidio, line 4) in the passage refers to the Punic Wars, a series of conflicts between Rome and Carthage during which two centuries?

choices.label: The sixth and fifth centuries BCE
The third and second centuries BCE
The first and second centuries CE
The second and third centuries CE

content.answer: The third and second centuries BCE

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 2.B: Describe historical and cultural contexts of Latin texts.
